text: So we have a pretty in-depth onboarding process for every client, and we refer to that as our “consultation phase” and yes we do charge for it, because we put a gazillion hours into determining goals & kpis, competitive analysis, target audience analysis (including interviews), and then prepping the first 3 months of the campaign and presenting that so we can flip switches when they say go. we also often include a brand positioning and messaging deliverable too. So basically, the first 5-6 weeks of a relationship is that stuff and it’s a flat fee, then they say go and we turn on the monthly retainer. This is at a regular marketing agency so content is a piece of this but not all of it

elements.text: So we have a pretty in-depth onboarding process for every client, and we refer to that as our “consultation phase” and yes we do charge for it, because we put a gazillion hours into determining goals & kpis, competitive analysis, target audience analysis (including interviews), and then prepping the first 3 months of the campaign and presenting that so we can flip switches when they say go. we also often include a brand positioning and messaging deliverable too. So basically, the first 5-6 weeks of a relationship is that stuff and it’s a flat fee, then they say go and we turn on the monthly retainer. This is at a regular marketing agency so content is a piece of this but not all of it

text:
When I was in fintech we worked with a marketing agency. It was basically month-to-month with a 30-day notice to cancel and was all kinds of marketing, not just content.

The agency did charge a pretty hefty setup fee, but we didn't think anything of it - we knew that they were putting a lot of hours into getting to know us as a company and work up a strategy.

When I was in fintech we worked with a marketing agency. It was basically month-to-month with a 30-day notice to cancel and was all kinds of marketing, not just content.

The agency did charge a pretty hefty setup fee, but we didn't think anything of it - we knew that they were putting a lot of hours into getting to know us as a company and work up a strategy.
